Proposal for Glorifying Three Generals' Exploits Supported 
    Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The Asian Regional Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the All-India Indo-Korean Friendship Association and the Indian Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification in a joint statement on March 20 extended full support to the proposal of Mongolian organizations to hold a meeting in praise of the three generals of Mt. Paektu in the area of the secrete camp of Mt. Paektu and erect a monument to their greatness in 2005 which will mark the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 Socialist Korea has firmly protected the sovereignty of the country and the nation despite the blatant challenge of the imperialist allied forces, the statement said, adding it is widely known to the world people that this reality would have been unthinkable without the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung, anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and leader Kim Jong Il.    
 It expressed belief that the monument to their greatness would give a strong impetus to the human cause of independence and all the progressives of the world in the 21st century.

S. Korean Students Go on Sit-in Strike
    Pyongyang, March 27 (KCNA) -- Students under the Seoul District Federation of University Student Councils reportedly held a press conference at the Myongdong Cathedral in Seoul on March 21 before going on an emergency sit-in strike at the Myongdong Cathedral to dismantle the 16th-term National Assembly, check the political coup and judge corrupt politicians in the April general election.
 At the press conference Kim Mi Suk, chairwoman of the Tongari Federation of Duksong Women's University who is head of the emergency sit-in strike group, said that people's resentment is daily growing stronger in the wake of the passage of the motion on impeachment through the National Assembly and that the strike would certainly judge the corrupt politicians in the April general election with the strength of youth and students.    
 She declared that the sit-in strike group would conduct information activities such as distributing literature among citizens everyday and take part in the candlelight demonstration, too.

Lebanese Preparatory Committee Formed
    Pyongyang, March 27 (KCNA) -- A Lebanese preparatory committee was formed on March 17 to commemorate the Day of the Sun.
 Zaher al Khatib, secretary general of the Lebanonese Federation of Workers who is chairman of the Lebanese Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful functions introducing the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
